Computer Graphics Programming Assignment
  • Question Thirteen
  • View page source

Question Thirteen

Write a program that allows a user to play a simple version of solitaire. First, design a simple set of cards using only our basic primitives. Your program can be written in terms of picking rectangular objects.

Card Class

class Card

Represents a playing card with a suit and rank.

Variables:

  • suit (str) – The suit of the card (’♠’, ‘♥’, ‘♦’, ‘♣’).

  • rank (str) – The rank of the card (‘A’, ‘2’, …, ‘10’, ‘J’, ‘Q’, ‘K’).

__init__(suit, rank)

Initialize a Card object.

Parameters:

  • suit (str) – The suit of the card (’♠’, ‘♥’, ‘♦’, ‘♣’).

  • rank (str) – The rank of the card (‘A’, ‘2’, …, ‘10’, ‘J’, ‘Q’, ‘K’).

Deck Class

class Deck

Represents a deck of playing cards.

Variables:

cards (list) – List of Card objects in the deck.

__init__()

Initialize a Deck object with a list of Card objects.

create_deck()

Create a standard deck of 52 playing cards.

shuffle()

Shuffle the deck of cards.

SolitaireGame Class

class SolitaireGame

Represents the main Solitaire game logic.

Variables:

  • deck (Deck) – Deck object representing the playing cards.

  • card_x (int) – X-coordinate for card positions.

  • card_y (int) – Y-coordinate for card positions.

  • background (Image) – Background image using PIL.

  • draw (ImageDraw) – ImageDraw object for drawing on the background.

  • background_image (Surface) – Pygame Surface object representing the background image.

__init__()

Initialize a SolitaireGame object.

create_window()

Create the game window and draw the initial cards.

run_game()

Run the main game loop.

load_image(file_path)

Load an image using PIL and convert it to a Pygame surface.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – Path to the image file.

Returns:

Pygame Surface object representing the loaded image.

draw_card(position, card)

Draw a card on the background image.

Parameters:

  • position (tuple) – Tuple representing the position of the card (x1, y1, x2, y2).

  • card (Card) – Card object to be drawn.

Example Usage:

  • Create an instance of SolitaireGame.

  • Run the main game loop.
